channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: David Lynch Dead: ‘Twin Peaks’ and ‘Mulholland Drive’ Director Was 78
item.description: A visionary, his films included “Eraserhead,” “Blue Velvet” and “Mulholland Drive,” considered his masterwork. He brought his skewed view to the small...

item.title: Banning phones in schools is now getting support from both red and blue states alike: ‘We have not done our job as grown-ups’
item.description: At least eight states have banned phone usage over the past two years, and proposals are being considered in several more states this year.

item.title: Sudan’s Military Has Used Chemical Weapons Twice, U.S. Officials Say
item.description: The determination came as the United States announced sanctions against the Sudanese military chief, saying there was strong evidence of atrocities in...

item.title: You can now schedule ChatGPT to perform actions in the future, like setting reminders or getting weekly personalized news briefings
item.description: OpenAI president Greg Brockman says the company is doubling down on AI “agents” in 2025.

item.title: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser is still committed to her $1 billion efficiency push: ‘The best is still ahead’
item.description: Citigroup beat earnings expectations, posting a profit in the fourth quarter with a net income of $2.86 billion.

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Cabinet Vote on Cease-Fire Not Expected Until at Least Friday
item.description: The cabinet must ratify the deal, which would include the release of hostages. Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said he was confident it would sta...

item.title: Saif Ali Khan, Famed Bollywood Actor, Is Stabbed at Home in Mumbai
item.description: The police said Mr. Khan was recovering in the hospital after an intruder attacked him. He sustained a major injury to his spinal cord, a doctor said.

item.title: The Washington Post’s New Mission: Reach ‘All of America’
item.description: This week, The Post began trying out a new mission statement: “Riveting Storytelling for All of America.”

item.title: Hamas After Cease-Fire: Weakened but Still the Dominant Palestinian Power in Gaza
item.description: Hamas remains the dominant Palestinian power in Gaza even after 15 months of Israeli bombardment, holding sway in displacement camps and refusing to s...

item.title: Patients Are Dying in Hospital Corridors, British Nurses Say
item.description: A damning report on overcrowded hospitals added fuel to a painful debate over the crises at the National Health Service.

item.title: TikTok’s CEO is planning to attend Trump’s inauguration. He’ll see Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and Jeff Bezos
item.description: Donald Trump’s inauguration is a day after a ban on the app could take effect.

item.title: Block agrees to pay $120 million in refunds to resolve Cash App fraud
item.description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau announced the order on Thursday in the waning days of the Biden administration.

item.title: Bob Uecker, Clubhouse Wit-Turned-Popular Sportscaster, Dies at 90
item.description: Uecker turned his meager baseball career into humorous fodder covering games on TV and as a commercial pitchman.
